intro: Montbretia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered yellow star. It is a perennial herb native to South Africa, characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with clustered blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. Its flowers have six petals and are often arranged in dense inflorescences, making it a striking addition to gardens. Montbretia pauciflora is well-suited to dry, sunny conditions and is relatively easy to cultivate.
